event.title: /ˈwᵻstə/ WISS-tə) is a city and the historic county seat of Worcester County, Massachusetts, United States until Massachusetts disbanded county government in 1998

data.event: Worcester (/ˈwʊstər/ WUUSS-tər, locally also /ˈwᵻstə/ WISS-tə) is a city and the historic county seat of Worcester County, Massachusetts, United States until Massachusetts disbanded county government in 1998.

event.title: Named after Worcester, England, as of the 2010

data.event: Named after Worcester, England, as of the 2010 Census the city's population was 181,045, making it the second largest city in New England after Boston.

event.title: that Valentine's Day cards were invented

data.event: However, the heart symbol may also have its provenance in lore that Valentine's Day cards were invented in the city.

event.title: was considered its own region for centuries

data.event: Worcester was considered its own region for centuries; however, with the encroachment of Boston's suburbs in the 1970s after the construction of Interstate 495 and Interstate 290, it now marks the western periphery of the Boston-Worcester-Providence (MA-RI-NH) U.S. Census Combined Statistical Area (CSA), or Greater Boston.

event.title: the construction of Interstate 495 and Interstate 290, it now

data.event: Worcester was considered its own region for centuries; however, with the encroachment of Boston's suburbs in the 1970s after the construction of Interstate 495 and Interstate 290, it now marks the western periphery of the Boston-Worcester-Providence (MA-RI-NH) U.S. Census Combined Statistical Area (CSA), or Greater Boston.
